newsitem.title: USA: Republic Industries names Berrard president.
newsitem.headline: Republic Industries names Berrard president.

text.p: Republic Industries Inc said Wednesday that it named Steven Berrard president, co-chief executive and a member of its board.
The company said that due to dramatic expansion and expected growth in the automotive sector, Republic decided to expand its most senior management position.
Chairman and Chief Executive H. Wayne Huizenga said in a release that he would share the responsibilities and office of chief executive with Berrrard.
Republic also appointed Harris Hudson to vice chairman of the company.
Berrard and Huizenga have worked together for over 15 years in business ventures, including Viacom Inc's Blockbuster Entertainment.
Hudson will also serve as chairman of Republic's Waste and Security Services divisions.
Prior to joining the company, Berrard served as chief executive at AutoNation USA.
Republic Industries had previously reported it expects to acquire AutoNation USA in December 1996.
Harris Hudson had served as Republic's president.
